Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • Parser
  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser for PascalMaisPresque. The parser implements a recursive descend mimicking the run of the pushdown automaton: the call stack replacing the automaton stack.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Symbol current
      Current symbol at the head of the word to be read.

      translation of the code into llvm language

      Option to print only the rule number (false) or the full rule (true).
      private int if_counter
      counter of the number of if condition to have different label names
      private static int log10ruleCard
      Width (in characters) of the highest rule number.

      boolean that indicates if the print function has been used
      private boolean read
      boolean that indicates if the read function has been used

      Lexer object for the parsed file.

      counter of the temporary variable asssignation

      variable table containing variables that have been assigned before

      counter of the number of while loop to have different label names
      private static int widestNonTerm
      Width (in characters) of the widest left handside in a production rule.

    • Field Detail

      • scanner

        private LexicalAnalyzer scanner
        Lexer object for the parsed file.

      • current

        private Symbol current
        Current symbol at the head of the word to be read. This corresponds to the look-ahead (of length 1).

      • fullRuleDisplay

        private boolean fullRuleDisplay
        Option to print only the rule number (false) or the full rule (true).

      • ruleOutput

        private static void ruleOutput​(int rNum,
                               java.lang.String ruleLhs,
                               java.lang.String ruleRhs,
                               boolean full)
        Outputs the rule used in the LL descent.
        Parameters:
        rNum - the rule number.
        ruleLhs - the left hand-side of the rule as a String.
        ruleRhs - the right hand-side of the rule as a String.
        full - a boolean specifying whether to write only the rule number (false) or the full rule (true).

      • ruleOutput

        private void ruleOutput​(int rNum,
                        java.lang.String ruleLhs,
                        java.lang.String ruleRhs)
        Outputs the rule used in the LL descent, using the fullRuleDisplay value to set the option of full display or not.
        Parameters:
        rNum - the rule number.
        ruleLhs - the left hand-side of the rule as a String.
        ruleRhs - the right hand-side of the rule as a String.

      • match

        private ParseTree match​(LexicalUnit token)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        ParseException
        Matches a (terminal) token from the head of the word.
        Parameters:
        token - then LexicalUnit (terminal) to be matched.
        Returns:
        a ParseTree made of a single leaf (the matched terminal).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the matching fails (syntax error): the next tolen is not the one to be matched.

      • parse

        public ParseTree parse()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ParseException
        Parses the file and writes the llvm code on this standard output.
        Returns:
        a ParseTree containing the parsed file structured by the grammar rules.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • program

        private ParseTree program()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          ParseException
        Treats a <Program> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [1] <Program> → begin <Code> end
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Program> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • code

        private ParseTree code()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ParseException
        Treats a <Code> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
        • [2] <Code> → <InstList>
        • [3] <Code> → ε
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Code> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

        private ParseTree instructionList()
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  ParseException
        Treats a <InstList> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [4] <InstList> → <Instruction><InstListTail>
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <InstList> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • instruction

        private ParseTree instruction()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ParseException
        Treats a <Instruction> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
        • [7] <Instruction> → <Assign>
        • [8] <Instruction> → <If>
        • [9] <Instruction> → <While>
        • [10] <Instruction> → <Print>
        • [11] <Instruction> → <Read>
        • [12] <Instruction> → begin <InstList> end
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Instruction> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • assignExpr

        private ParseTree assignExpr()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ParseException
        Treats a <Assign> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [13] <Assign> → [Varname]:=<ExprArith> if the rule is matched, it generates the llvm code corresponding to the assign it also add the variable to the varTable
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Assign> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

        private ParseTree exprArith()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            ParseException
        Treats a <ExprArith> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [14] <ExprArith> → <Prod><ExprArith'>
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <ExprArith> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • exprArithPrime

        private ParseTree exprArithPrime()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 ParseException
        Treats a <ExprArith'> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
        • [15] <ExprArith'> → +<Prod><ExprArith'>
        • [16] <ExprArith'> → -<Prod><ExprArith'>
        • [17] <ExprArith'> → ε
        It generates the llvm instruction for the addition or the difference and stores them in temporary variable
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <ExprArith'> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

        private ParseTree prodPrime()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            ParseException
        Treats a <Prod'> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
        • [19] <Prod'> → *<Atom><Prod'>
        • [20] <Prod'> → /<Atom><Prod'>
        • [21] <Prod'> → ε
        Generates the llvm instruction for the multipkication / division and stores them in temporary variable
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Prod'> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).

      • atom

        private ParseTree atom()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ParseException
        Treats a <Atom> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
        • [22] <Atom> → -<Atom>
        • [23] <Atom> → (<ExprArith>)
        • [24] <Atom> → [VarName]
        • [25] <Atom> → [Number]
        Generates the llvm code for atom expression and stores them in temporary variable
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Atom> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      • ifExpr

        private ParseTree ifExpr()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         ParseException
        Treats a <If> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [26] <If> → if <Cond> then <Instruction> else<IfTail> Generates the llvm instruction for an if statement: first generates the condtion then uses br to go to the iftrue label or the iffalse label finaly writes the iffalse and iftrue code parts. The end of these p√¢rts is sent with br to the endif label
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <If> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

        private ParseTree printExpr()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            ParseException
        Treats a <Print> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [40] <Print> → print([Varname]) Writes the llvm code for the read instruction Checks if the variable is in the VarTable, throws an error if not
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • readExpr

        private ParseTree readExpr()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           ParseException
        Treats a <Read> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [41] <Read> → read([Varname]) Writes the llvm code for the read instruction add the variable to the VarTable
        Returns:
        a ParseTree with a <Read> non-terminal at the root.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
        ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).
